Package org.webpki.cbor

Class CBORInteger

java.lang.Object
org.webpki.cbor.CBORObject
org.webpki.cbor.CBORInteger
public class CBORInteger extends CBORObject
Class for holding CBOR integer and big integer. Note that the encoder is adaptive, selecting the shortest possible representation in order to produce a fully deterministic result.

  • Constructor Details

    • CBORInteger

      public CBORInteger(long value)
      Create a CBOR integer.

      Note: this constructor assumes that value is a signed long.

      See CBORInteger(long,boolean).
      Parameters:
      value - Integer in long format

    • CBORInteger

      public CBORInteger(long value, boolean unsigned)
      Create a CBOR unsigned integer or negative integer. To cope with the entire 65-bit integer span supported by CBOR you must use this constructor. Unsigned integers range from 0 to 2^64-1, while negative integers range from -1 to -2^64.

      If the unsigned flag is set to false, this constructor assumes CBOR native encoding mode for negative integers. That is, value is treated as an unsigned magnitude which is subsequently negated and subtracted by 1. This means that the input values 0, 43, and -9223372036854775808L, actually represent -1, -44, and -9223372036854775809 respectively. A special case is the value 0xffffffffffffffffL (long -1), which corresponds to -2^64.

      See CBORInteger(long) and CBORInteger(BigInteger).
      Parameters:
      value - long value
      unsigned - true if value should be considered as unsigned

    • CBORInteger

      public CBORInteger(BigInteger value)
      Creates a CBOR integer value of any size.

      If value is within the CBOR integer range, the integer type will be used, otherwise serializations will use the big integer type.

      Parameters:
      value - Integer in BigInteger format
